website_summaries.verdict: A long list of promises goes unfulfilled with the overpriced Spree Sport fitness monitoring headband. Stick to a smart sports watch with chest strap or wristband heart rate monitor for now.
pros: Comfortable headband sports tracker with heart rate monitor
cons: Tracker pod pops out of headband too easily when not in use
Doesn't report all the data it collects

customer_reviews.title: The product is not worth a penny. 1. ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is not worth a penny. 1. The device: it has no way to stay in it's place on the band, it only stays where it should be because of the force of your forehead on the band. 2. The software: An entry-level software engineer wouldn't develop it that way, it has very limited information, it don't display the body temperature, it don't show you a curve for your heart rate for the period of the workout, it just provide you with your average heart rate, it don't provide a curve for the calories expenditure, it just gives an average. I wouldn't pay a penny for that product.
customer_reviews.author: Bishoy

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Works until you sweat on it and then won't charge. This is the second one I've ordered and both suffered the same fate. Emails and called the company...no response after several attempts. Too bad too...love the idea/design.
customer_reviews.author: T Erskine

customer_reviews.title: missing app!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m highly annoyed that the Spree app is NOT on the itunes app store. It does seem to sync with other apps. I’m still testing and will update this late
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed that the temp sensor doesn't register
customer_reviews.text: As I am having issues with becoming overheated during workouts, I'm disappointed that the temp sensor doesn't register. Other than that, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllisa L. Conlin

customer_reviews.title: Love my spree
customer_reviews.text: I love my spree!! This great device tells me how hard I worked out (or not), it measures my body temperature and counts burned calories. I just wished they would have more activities to chose from - missing my favorite sport tennis, but I log it as running :)
customer_reviews.author: Eva Aikey

customer_reviews.title: One-of-a-kind
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Fits nicely and comfortably around your head and stays in place throughout the workout. I use mine when I run to calculate distance and make sure i'm at my optimal level of intensity. It's helping ensure I reach my goals while training for my first half marathon. I'm also buying one for my dad for Father's Day to keep him from overheating this summer as he works outside! No other product out there like this. Plus, it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Snug not vice
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have to be super tight around your head to work!!
customer_reviews.author: DarneseGM

customer_reviews.title: The recommended headband placement somewhat awkward looking for a more casual ...
customer_reviews.text: The recommended headband placement somewhat awkward looking for a more casual walker like me, and for more intense workouts is difficult to keep in place. Note that some earlier reviews mentioned lack of Android support, which has since been rectified, but the temperature tracking just plain doesn't add much to justify the extra effort. Probably a hard core athlete might find this useful. I will stick with an armband.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Bielefeldt

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like that it gives what seems to be very accurate information, but I prefer a system that gives you an overall activity level like a body media band does. I know that I am misusing heart rate with those, but I think I get a better 24 hour picture with that type of band plus a true heart rate monitor. I am not in love with the forehead wearing either, but I did find it to be less moody that the chest strap systems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work/be reliable
customer_reviews.text: Partly that is because I do not have an iPhone, and--as per manufacturer's instructions--must use another app with my Android (or iPad) to track my workout (my fitness pal; track my run). Neither records body temperature, which really is not a big deal. What's more of a problem is that both the Android and the iPad recorded the data inconsistently, and cut out mid- workout. Maybe this works great with an iPhone. But it doesn't work great with the non-Spree apps through other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Worddancer Redux

customer_reviews.title: Another user who couldn't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive the Spree to review, as I love fitness technology and have used Fitbits and BodyMedia Fits in the past. However, the Spree is 1) dorky-looking and 2) technically just not ready for primetime. I immediately had pairing issues and while customer service was responsive, I was never successful in syncing it to my iPhone. To be honest, I can't say I'd be terribly eager to run around town wearing this thing anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis B.

product_meta.title: Spree Bluetooth Fitness Heart Rate Monitor
feature_bullets: Headband placement gives you the most accurate reading for body temperature, heart rate and calories burned
Keeps you from injury or health risk by finding your optimum zone for intensity, body temperature, and movement
The only workout device with body temperature monitoring so you get an effective workout without risk of over heating
Soft touch silicone band comfortably conforms to your forehead to block sweat, Spree app monitors your performance, and keeps track of your workout.
Spree App for Android (4.4.2 and up - Samsung Galaxy S3 & up, HTC One M8, LG G3), iOS (iPhone 4S & up, iPod/iPad 3 & up) and selected 3rd-party apps

specifications.Manufacturer: Global Trade and Technology Corp - Sports
